page.title: 09Recreation (cont)
page.content: Fox hunting is the only organised hunting and the area is known as the "Wednesday Country" of the Southdown and Eridge Foxhounds. Cub hunting begins in mid September when the informal meets start at about 7am as the scent disappears with the midday sun. The first real hunt takes place on the second Wednesday of November each year. There are four acting Joint Masters and the pack of hounds usually consists of about "8 couples". The number of Horse followers can vary from 20 up to 50. Meets take place either in the car park of a local Inn or by invitation at a private country house where a stirrup cup is drunk. There is also an organised Foot Followers Club which runs fund raising events to support the hunt.
